metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5029 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The web interface in CUPS 1.7.4 allows local users in the lp group to read arbitrary files via a symlink attack on a file in /var/cache/cups/rss/ and language[0] set to null.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2014-3537.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5029` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
cups-bsd - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
cups-client - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
cups-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
cups-core-drivers - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
cups-daemon - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
cups-ppdc - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
cups-server-common - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
libcups2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
libcupscgi1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
libcupsimage2 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
libcupsmime1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
libcupsppdc1 - 1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> The patch below introduces a regression preventing the web interface from being able to read log files. (See comments in bug 4455.)

criterions.comment: cups package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.7.2-0ubuntu1.2').
